material.mattext: The alternative hypothesis in this case is:
The more educated a person is, the less likely he/she is to smoke.
Whether a person is a smoker or not is not related to his/her level of education.
There is no difference between those who have a Bachelor's degree or higher and those who do not have a high-school diploma in smokers rate.
Whether a person is a smoker or not is related to his/her level of education.

Incorrect. While it is true that this claim could be an alternative hypothesis, it is not the alternative hypothesis in this case. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.
Incorrect. The claim you chose is the null hypothesis. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.

Incorrect. While it is true that this claim could be an alternative hypothesis, it is not the alternative hypothesis in this case. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.
Good Job! Indeed, the alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. In this case we want to check whether smoking habits are related to level of education.
